required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cell-based Therapy for the Treatment of Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Cell-based Therapy for the Treatment of Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Endothelial progenitor cells derived from and delivered to the renal vasculature may be stimulated to initiate differentiation programs during episodes of injury. We hypothesize that endothelial progenitor cells from the kidney can transition to a phenotype that promotes endothelial repair.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an interventional study involving patients that have a diagnosis of chronic kidney disease. Patients will have at least stage 3 chronic kidney disease stage or greater. Kidney-derived endothelial progenitor cells will have been obtained using associated protocols that are currently approved by the Partners Human Research Committee.

primary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine will be measured after cell delivery

arm_group.description: Patients will be given autologous endothelial progenitor cells

intervention.description: Kidney-derived endothelial progenitor cells will be delivered percutaneously to the kidney blood supply.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled patients will have endothelial progenitor cells previously acquired.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients without previously acquired endothelial progenitor cells will be excluded.

patient_data.ipd_description: Outcomes of individual participant data will be made available in a de-identified fashion.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The clinical study report will be available at the conclusion of the study.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests will be made to the study principal investigator.
